A merchant buys a number of oranges at $ 3$ for $ 10$ cents and an equal number at $ 5$ for $ 20$ cents.  To "break even" he must sell all at:\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ \text{8 for 30 cents} \qquad
\textbf{(B)}\ \text{3 for 11 cents} \qquad
\textbf{(C)}\ \text{5 for 18 cents} \\
\textbf{(D)}\ \text{11 for 40 cents} \qquad
\textbf{(E)}\ \text{13 for 50 cents}$
